channel.title: work on Jacopo Donati
channel.description: Recent content in work on Jacopo Donati

item.title: The next note
item.description: When you hit a wrong note, it’s the next note that makes it good or bad.

item.title: Be a good one
item.description: Whatever you are, be a good one.

item.title: Part of the dance
item.description: You can do it like it’s a great weight, or you can do it like it’s part of the dance.

item.title: Until it's sold
item.description: There is no art until it’s on paper, there is no art until it’s sold.

item.title: Your taste
item.description: Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer.

item.title: Don't fight them. Don't waste your time
item.description: I: You have some wonderful stories of basically getting away with stuff at the studios. MB: I’d learned one very simple trick: say yes. Simply say yes. Like Joseph E. Levine, on The Producers, said, “The curly-haired guy—he’s funny looking. Fire him.” He wanted me to fire Gene Wilder. And I said, “Yes, he’s gone. I’m firing him.” I never did. But he forgot. After the screening of Blazing Saddles, the head of Warner Bros.

item.title: the world is movement
item.description: For the world is movement, and you cannot be stationary in your attitude toward something that is moving.
